Award.AwardTitle: Student Travel Support for the 2018 ACM SIGMETRICS International Conference on Measurement and Modeling of Computer Systems (SIGMETRICS 2018)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
The 2018 Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) Special Interest Group on Measurement and Evaluation (SIGMETRICS) conference will be held at Beckman Center, Irvine, California on June 18-22, 2018. SIGMETRICS brings together professionals from academic and industrial backgrounds in what has become a premier forum for discussing the development and application of state-of-the-art, broadly applicable analytic, simulation, and measurement-based performance evaluation techniques. The SIGMETRICS conference presents innovative, exciting work related to all aspects of performance for all types of computer systems. Highly original ideas, new approaches, and/or ground breaking results are expected.

Travel support will make possible the participation of students who would otherwise be unable to attend. Particular attention is paid to directing support towards under-represented groups, e.g., gender or ethnic minorities and students from smaller or less well-known institutions. The support will provide students who attend with the opportunity to interact with a diverse group of mentors and peers, furthering their education.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
This award supported the travel of 35 students to the 2018 Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) Special Interest Group on Measurement and Evaluation (SIGMETRICS) conference, which was held at Beckman Center, Irvine, California on June 18-22, 2018. SIGMETRICS brings together professionals from academic and industrial backgrounds in what has become a premier forum for discussing the development and application of state-of-the-art, broadly applicable analytic, simulation, and measurement-based performance evaluation techniques. The SIGMETRICS conference presents innovative, exciting work related to all aspects of performance for all types of computer systems. Highly original ideas, new approaches, and/or ground breaking results were presented. 

By supporting the travel of students who would be otherwise unable to attend the conference, this award promoted the development of young researchers in the SIGMETRICS community and furthered their education. Fifteen grant recipients did not have a paper at the conference, and ten are members of underrepresented groups in computer science. Twenty-seven recipients were first-time attendees of SIGMETRICS. All recipients attended paper and poster presentations as well as social events, allowing them to see what a conference presentation looks like, to learn more about current performance evaluation research, and to network with more established members of the community. Four recipients presented posters on their work, and fifteen recipients presented papers.
